Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: curiousGuy
Reviews.Content: The room is small, you can hear the traffic, it's not the Hilton but for the price you couldn't ask for more. We spent three nights at the Parador Villa Parguera and have no complaints. The parador is a bit dated but compared to other paradors that I have stayed at this one has to be the best. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The grounds are very well kept and the view of the bay is beautiful. The area itself is a very sleepy except for the weekends when the town square comes alive. When making reservations as for a room in the caribe wing as these are buffered from the traffic noise better than the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as we travelled around the island. The parador is a sweet little place, we had a second floor room which was a comfortable size for two, very clean with a fresh tropical decor and a balcony with a view. The beds were comfortable , the bathroom was a bit dated but clean and more than adequate. The grounds were immaculate and enjoyablable to walk around or just sit and relax. The pool was clean and opened early good way to begin the day. The ac worked well. Front desk satff were polite, helpful and bilingual. The hotel is very well located. We were right near the town square and Johnny's Boats. We did not eat at the restaurant wishing to explore the small town. The town square comes to life at night with vendors and food staff , do not miss the marlin from the kebob stand it was great and went very well with Medella beer. We did go out into the Phosphorescent Bay and were disappointed. I have been there before and saw little activity this visit though it was a clear still evening,I found the boat very crowded and the I guess diesel (?) smell from the boat was unpleasant. I didn;t rememeber this from past visits. It was very safe and enjoyable to walk around the town don't miss Moon's Bar very enjoyable stop for a drink and tapas- fresh, tasty and well served , great customer service. There isn't much in the town which makes it a nice low key stop in a tourist friendly area. I recommend it for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “An amazingly charming hotel with a staff that treats you like family.”
Reviews.Author: Laurieface
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel of 74 rooms is more like a country inn facing a peaceful stretch of the Carribean Sea. The rooms with porch or balcony face a grassy lawn studded with palm trees and a peaceful view of a quiet harbor beyond. There is an inviting swimming pool and another section with a nice little courtyard. The courtyard rooms also looked good, but did not have the view. The dining room and bar service were excellent and the staff bent over backwards to accommodate any requests. One day, we came back to our room around 3PM but the bar/restaurant was not yet open. I asked the woman at the front desk if there was any way to get a glass of wine. She said "absolutely," then got up, went behind the bar, filled a wine glass and told me she would charge it to my room later as she did not have access to the cash register inside the bar! Also, the hot coffee was available every morning in the lobby at 6AM sharp, so we could enjoy our coffee on our patio while watching the sunrise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place by the sea”
Reviews.Author: CaptainNorm
Reviews.Content: A beautiful setting on the Caribbean Sea. The hotel may be old but in a nice setting .If you are looking for a five star hotel this is not it .The rooms are nice and clean, the maid service is excellent. The food was very good with a Puerto Rican flavor.The town is small and has a small supermarket for you needs. You are in walking distance to all water activities, Kayaking ,snorkeling, swimming ,scuba or just laying on the beach.. It is a family run establishment where the staff is helpfull and friendly.. Whould I stay there again YES

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but...”
Reviews.Author: arccc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the Christmas weekend. I think is a great place but I can not give a punctuation of excellence for one reason. They offer a package that will include breakfast, lunch and dinner and on weekends have a lunch and breakfast buffet, and is very good. But at least at dinner when they offer any dessert or drink other than water, they charge you that without telling you anything. When you finish and they'll surprise you with the bill and you have to pay it. The most ironic part is that inside the hotel they have soda's vendor machines and are cheaper and have more content than what they offer in the restaurant. Other than that the place seemed very good! Well maintained, very good air conditioning and the areas are very well cared and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible night”
Reviews.Author: Nannytraveller
Reviews.Content: This five star wanna be guest house is expensive. I had stay in motels that have a best quality. The room was terrible, was so small. The TV are prehistorical , bad cable reception, the toilet was broken. The area have a nice nocturnal live, but It doesn't have to feel in your room,, NO noise insulation. Mosquitoes in the room. They doesn't put you a bracelet and they are constantly asking you if you aree staying at the place..a bad pain.... (I think they are invoicing you enough money for that!!!) They rent you the room for 4 and they does not have even a two full beds for 4 adults. I did understand how they have the nerve to invoice you more than $100 per night for this place in low season....please people, area is nice, but your facilities and service are a terrible experience...

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodations in the heart of LaParguera”
Reviews.Author: NHTraveler03885
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Villa Parguera of and on for over 35 years. I first stayed there at age 13 with my parents and it hasn't changed much since then. Located right in town abutting the town square (such as it is) you want to make sure that you get a room in the center of the complex. Other wise you will be in for some noise. Parguera is a sleepy village and a favorite tourist spot for Puerto Ricans who come to see Phosphorescent Bay. The Villa P is a sleepy little hotel, too, except for on holiday nights when their night club is the hottest thing around. This are basic, clean rooms with plenty of hot water. The A/Cs have all been replaced with nice quiet units. The beds are a little old, but you can get a good night's sleep. Do not plan to eat at the hotel, especially breakfast. The food is fair at best and not good at worst. I don't understand why, in a place where fresh fruit grows year round, they serve awful canned fruit cocktail. Lots of carbs here; nothing like gravy on french fries, but that is apparently what the locals want. I would not recommend going to La Parguera as a tourist unless you plan to rent a boat and head out into the mangroves or to one of the reefs for diving and snorkeling. There is not much to do in town once you have visited the 4-5 shops.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay at La Parguera”
Reviews.Author: alfgomezjr
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay at La Parguera. Check-in and check-out are hassle-free. Food is very good, waiters, maids, front desk personnel and the manager (that has been working here forever) are very competent, cheerful and accomodating. Rooms are very clean, A/C works very well, the hotel is very well kept. We visit this hotel alone and with our granddaughters at least twice a year. I have been coming to this hotel for the past 24 years with absolutely NO COMPLAINTS. We always rent a small boat (drive yourself) from Johnny's Boats rental next to the hotel and have been treated fairly all the time. The rates are very reasonable all year long. We recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place... best in Lajas”
Reviews.Author: alextm21
Reviews.Content: o During the weekend of the 4th the july I stay in Parador Villar Parguera in Lajas, PR. We arrive early, check in was at 3pm and me and my wife arrive around 12:30 to 1:00pm. The check us early with no charge. The room was in the Patio area of the hotel. The room was for 4 people, but we didnâ€™t mind having two beds (one for us and the other for the luggage) We pay around $490 from Friday to Monday with two dinners include, two breakfast and on Saturday night we got a show (music and comedy show). The pool was nice, open from 7am to 6pm, but sometime they let you until 7:30 and thatâ€™s nice, especially during summer where days are longer. Right next to the Hotel is the famous Parguera Bio Bay boat tours, restaurants and bars. During the night they have small â€œkioskosâ€� selling all kind of puertorican food like alcapurrias, pinchos, pinca coladas, piraguas and etc, so thatâ€™s nice. The bio bay tours next to the hotel named Johnny Boats cost only $6 per person and you can dive if you want. Thatâ€™s the best way to enjoy the bio bay (Fajardoâ€™s Bio bay is way much better). The food in the restaurant was nice and the buffet was good too. The staff was friendly at all moment. Iâ€™m planning on taking my parents to the Parador in the near future. On a rate from 1 to 5, I gave them a 5 In Parador category and 3.8 in Hotel categories.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for our quick stop in the Southwest”
Reviews.Author: Bobo185
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parador Villa Parguera as part of a birdwatching trip with Birding Puerto Rico so I do not know the cost of the rooms so cannot comment on value. Our room was fairly standard with two twin beds, satellite TV, Wi-Fi, good air conditioning, hot water, and a balcony with a table and some chairs. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the courtyard and the bay. The room was clean and everything worked. We really did not hear anyone in the other units or outside while we were sleepingâ€¦the AC probably had something to do with that. The hotel is designed like a compound open to the bay. The hallway to the rooms is actually outside but has a roof. To get to the second floor you need to go up a few fairly steep steps to a landing that the doorways to two rooms share. We had some heavy luggage so it was awkward to maneuver it all up. They have a large dining room that has a full menu. The meals were included in our trip so I do not know the prices. For dinner, we joined an okay buffet dinner that was put on for a large group so we did not try anything from the menu. We did eat breakfast and they had everything you would expect in the US for breakfast and ours was goodâ€¦maybe a little slow on the coffee refills. The hotel is right on a very beautiful bay with aqua and blue waters and lots of small islands. There is no beach or swimming access to the ocean, but there is a dock for boats to take you out on excursions. The courtyard is nicely landscaped with lots of flowers and places to sit and relax. The pool looked nice and there was a bar near the water. There were various vending machines available for snacks and drinks near the rooms. We walked around the area at night and felt safe enough but there must be some reason that they have a guard at the front door, a walled compound with razor wire on top, and lock the boat dock access at night. Service was ok and most everyone spoke English. Check in and out was quick. Overall I would stay here again as the area is beautiful and this hotel has everything we neededâ€¦but wish there was some beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: niom-k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went a week last August for our anniversary. It fulfilled my expectations. Rooms are adecuate and comfortable, even if they're a little dated. The feel of it is like being at the beach, although the waterfront is not for bathing but more for boating. They have a very nice pool. The restaurant is one of the best features of the Parador. Excellent food! Very relaxing grounds. It is walking distance to all the area's hotspots and other restaurants. I would definitely recomend and would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Mlester3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing view of the water with a nice pool as well. They only have double beds which is not so great for tall people. And the rooms could definitely use updating. However, the location can't be beat. Also they have a very bizarre rule about not bringing alcohol or food on the premesis.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque setting, limited possibilities”
Reviews.Author: Mollysslave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this parador as part of a Road Scholar trip. The setting is pretty and restful, but the hotel is not very comfortable. The rooms are very small, the walls thin so you have to hope your neighbors are quiet, the bathrooms very small and outdated. The beds were clean--and yes we checked the mattresses etc--but not very comfortable. The food available in the dining room was mostly pedestrian. This is not a hotel I would choose for independent travel.

Reviews.Title: “IT STAYED IN THE 50'S”
Reviews.Author: BIGT60
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Room, nice with 2 beds, clean the problem the a/c when it cooled it made a noise like an old propeller plane you could not sleep (room #231). The bar and restaurant looke old and no a/c. The employees seem lofe-less, there's no service except for a young man called William, hwe would go out of his way to make things happen. Also arrived one afternoon to the pool from Caracoles, they told me that I could not have my cooler around the pool. There's no bar around the pool, and when I asked to get a dringk in the pool they told me that they don't have this kind of service. You can't enter the bar from the pool because there's a sign that says: "No one allowed in bathing suit in ths area" So you can't go to the bar to get a drink from the pool either. Last time I was there was around 10 years ago, it has not evolved with the times....

Reviews.Title: “Service Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Arr109
Reviews.Content: Hello; My spouse and I were looking for a Hotel near the Parguera area . we search and foun this one'.. When we got there everything went fine we checked in and we look around and the place is beutiful.. However when we called the front desk for Dinning info we were placed on hold for over 5 minutes... After 5 minutes a gentelmen pick up the phone: when i told him that I wanted to oreder a Burger he said hold for a minute and he left me holding: So I hung up and called aGAIN I was complained to the lady helping at the front desk about the service : She said the only thing I can do is transfer the call back to the dinning Phone; When finally someone answered I was told that the Restaurant was going to close.. I got upset becaUSE on the Room Wall they have a sign indicating that the restaurant is open till 10:00pm and it was only 8:15... They Gentlemen was very Rude and did not tack my order.. Having no other option we went out to eat Dinner.. Overall the hotel is very Nice However the Dinning personel sucks, Specially a Short man the have working there really Sucks.. All he did was Wine and complain about how late it was when it was only 815 at night.. Poeple working in Hotels should be warm and have manners, I will NEVER STAY Here again... To the owners you should hire better people or to better their service to host ive them a RAISE.....

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended if you must stay in this area”
Reviews.Author: jpcharlie
Reviews.Content: I kept checking over and over to see if the other people who wrote reviews here stayed at the same hotel as I did. The grounds are very nice. The staff might be nice but the owners must suck since each maid has her name stamped on the linen in the room and is responsible if they go missing. When you check in, they hand you a bag with the TV remote and the remote for the AC unit. What is that all about? The bathroom in the room was tiny and the drop ceiling had rust all over it. I asked if the hotel had Internet when I booked but when I arrived, I found none in the room. The front desk said that I should try the lobby or pool area and that did work OK for me. We arrived a bit early and asked about an early check-in but none was available. Since the hotel seems far from full, I can't see why they stuck to their 3:00 checkin rule. Our room was on the second floor up a narrow stairway and there was no elevator nor offer to have anyone carry our bags. If you like a firm bed, you won't be happy here, the mattress is very soft. It's certainly not the best hotel in the world and looking at other reviews, it might be the best available in the area, but I can not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, Good value”
Reviews.Author: deepersix
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a very central location in Parguera. The grounds are beautiful and the staff are friendly and accommodating. While the rooms are not luxurious, they are well equipped and clean. Additionally, they are well priced making this hotel a great value. For marine activities, the docks are just a short walk away. Also, there are a number of great restaurants within a 5 minute walk in either direction on the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Intlpvti
Reviews.Content: Situated in a charming little town, this "parador" is totally captivating. Beautiful ocean views from your ample balcony. Snorkeling,diving and boating activities abound. Far and away the best hotel I have found in Puerto Rico. I include in that assessment the Hiltons and DoubleTrees.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfotable, Amazing View!”
Reviews.Author: Ehight
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Parador Villa Paguera while passing through the area, and I am already dreaming of returning! Like other reveiwers have stated, the rooms are clean and comfortable but basic; however, the view from the pool deck is five star! Also the entire staff is friendly and aims to please. The restaraunt on site is tasty, but like the rooms, not overly fancy. On the whole we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, right on the sea”
Reviews.Author: Willister
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others. The rooms are very nice, we had an ocean front room with a small veranda and a wonderful view. Very relaxing to enjoy the view, also the pool was very nice, and we liked going out on the pier. Restaurant on site is very convenient. The grounds are well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, right in the heart of La Parguera”
Reviews.Author: Pomales
Reviews.Content: Liked the Hotel. Its location makes it the best choice to stay at La Parguera. Its near everything, restaurants, the boardwalk, supermarket, scuba diving shops.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location & View!!!”
Reviews.Author: nunillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right in front of the bay, steps from where you take the boat at night, small shops right next to hotel. The rooms are ok, they need some improvements but the view and location is awesome. They have a small restaurant but I don't recomment it. Right on the corner of the street there is a small "restaurant/bar" The Reef Pub they have the best battered fry chicken breast strips I've had in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: defiancexxx
Reviews.Content: First thing's first, it's a hotel in Lajas = small town. The place itself looks nice and is open air. Great views of the bay. Amazing garden to the far side of the hotel, very romantic and quiet. Staff was friendly and gave my a fair deal. Our room was on the small side on the second floor, room 208 with a great ocean view. Bring extension coords is you plan on pluging something into the tv. AC worked beautifully. Bathroom was small but very clean. Yes, there is running hot water. Pool is a good size and 9 feet at its deepest. Not a lot of walking room along the grounds, but good places to sit by the pool or overlooking the ocean which is nice for reading or going on your lap top. It's right next to the Parador which has a few bars and restaurants, also a few snorkeling and dive shops around which can take you out to sea. A tour of the flourescent bay. We paid $152 for 2 nights which is a good price if you're just wanting to be comfortable and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jburger037
Reviews.Content: driving around the island and staying wherever we landed for the night this was one of our favorites. the grounds and views of the Carribean are beautiful. while the amenities in the rooms are few we didn't miss them. close to boating, snorkeling and whatever else you can do on the water

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: rsc1117
Reviews.Content: First understand that Parador is Spanish for hostel. Knowing that going in is a BIG help. There are few amenities in this hotel. No clocks, hair dryers, mini-bars, etc. There also are very few electrical outlets; the few there are are not easily accessible. We ended up buying an extension cord at the grocery store with multiple plugs on it. The rooms are small but they were very clean and for the most part comfortable. Sure it could use a chair, but there is no room for it. The two queen beds were a bit uncomfortable for me, they were a bit worn. Each room has a patio or balcony that leads to or overlooks a beautiful courtyard and gorgeous bay. The grounds are very well kept. There is no beach here or swimming, but that can be found after a short drive. All we needed was a clean room at a great price. We are scuba divers so the location was perfect. Two dive shops within walking distance. In fact everything is within walking distance bars, restaurants, grocery store. Stop by there for breakfast. Most people speak SOME English, that helped. I recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't need a lot. Great location for the southern shore. Safe, secure and friendly,. We have found our vacation home.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic but very basic”
Reviews.Author: Lifesabrook
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location on the water (but not beachfront); popular with Puerto Ricans in the summer for ithe dry climate on this side of the island. Rooms very clean with balconies or terraces with pretty view. NO amenities, however, other than TV (remote is handed out with your room key!) ...not even Kleenex! This means no clock, hair dryer, etc. so come prepared. And research restaurants, as the one at the hotel is poor. No public transportation available.

Reviews.Title: “I just have one word, "Amazing"”
Reviews.Author: ortizjf07
Reviews.Content: I just love this place. If you are looking for a place to relax and have fun, this is the place. If you are looking for great beaches, this is the place. If you are looking for cleaness and friendly place, this is the place you want to stay. We can't wait to go back! You guy's have to visit the ilands. Take the boat and visit them, you are going to love them.....

Reviews.Title: “nice convienent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bcaaron
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good for our purpose. We chose this hotel because it was on the water and close to the dive shop. WEST DIVER is a GREAT dive shop.. Hotel is close to everything. The hotel restaurant is nice for the price, unfortunately it is not open early or late. The view was nice from the second floor if you could overlook the tin roof to the water. There was a nice little balcony to dry the dive gear. We will stay here again on our next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awful food!”
Reviews.Author: garyhillary
Reviews.Content: We were traveling in PR with PR friends and wanted sea food. The Hotel looked beautiful and the restaurant had a beautiful view. We liked the fact that it was "old fashioned". We should have been wary when our Pina Coladas arrived and they were horrible and cheap. The appetizers were over cooked. When our fish arrived it was dry and the vegetable were frozen and then boiled to death. A whole fish was sent back as it was dry and we were never served another. No manager came to apolagise but the entrees were taken off the bill. It still came to $30 for horrid drinks and overcooked appetizers.Hotel maybe OK but don't eat the food. In fact invite us back and we'll cook decent food for the customers. We did have our best meal of the vacation in Arecibo in a restaurant called Cafe Dominiqueno. Small, but clean and above all the food was home cooked, fresh and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Kate_PR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Parguera for a weekend in May and did not enjoy it at all. The place is not well kept and our room was outdated and thoroughly unimpressive. We were told that we had to buy a package deal with the meals included but the food there was so aweful that we ended up dining out instead. There are much better places to stay in Puerto Rico than this, I would suggest going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: lashlash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay here. The rooms were clean and the view was beautiful. Staff and locals were very friendly. There was an ATM right outside the villa and a convenience store just up the road. Everything is within walking distance. The air condition worked great thought there many cool evenings. Plenty of hot water in the rooms. Great parking with guard at lot. We dove with West Divers and had a lovely time. Would come back and stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: bectoria28237
Reviews.Content: Villa Parguera is like stepping back in time. The rooms on the first floor have an incredible view of the bay with private terraces, 121-125 are just steps from the bay with lounge chairs right in front of your room. It was hard to pull ourselves away from the lull of the water. We had breakfast included and would recommend it. Weekdays are very quiet, but weekends are noisy, lots of people partying. Just outside the hotel are the docks, markets and restaurants. Food is on the expensive side and not that great. Reef Pop had great fried chicken, we had dinner for 2 with drinks on the "patio" for $17. We bought wine at the market and sat by the bay in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mantino
Reviews.Content: A very good place to stay. We were there 2 nights but we could have stay longer. Price is good ($96 for a double queen bedroom) and you have free wi-fi internet, swimming pool, free parking. Everything was clean and the room service was very good. They really take care of you and they make your staying very pleasant. On Sundays there's a breakfast buffet for only $7, not too big but for only 7 bucks you can have fries, eggs and bacon, jam, french toast and coffee tea juice and fresh fruit. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at an affordable price...”
Reviews.Author: belle28b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary, so we wanted something cozy and serene. Villa Parguera is both. The front desk staff is great. The show is wonderful!, its funny and entertaining and the performers are really good. The rooms are a decent size and are a little worn but I think it adds to the charm of the place. We plan on going back with our children since its a very family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff- I would do again”
Reviews.Author: eyesguy
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat- overlooking a small bay with a large pool and immaculate grounds. Restaurant on site serves middle quality food- not super good, but decent and filling- sort of like dinner at home. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The room is average sized and the furnishings are 10-12 years old- more or less typical for all but the fanciest hotels in Puerto Rico. The rooms and areas were clean and neat, and everything was in good repair. Two years before, we stayed at La Jamaca in La Parguera- definitely a very low quality place. Villa Parguera costs 20% more and is about three times the quality. We plan to return

Reviews.Title: “Not a Friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl00765
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Parador Parguera the front desk seemed chaotic. The staff was not friendly at all and in fact it really seemed that they wondered what we were doing there. In my opinion it is a hotel that caters to wealthy Puerto ricans. We were not given any information about dinner in the restaurant or about the pool or the show that was posted on the outside of the hotel. NOTHING, NADA! Our room was O.K. but just a bare sheet on the bed no mattress pad at all. The shower could barely fit my husband who is six feet. When I showered the water was freezing. So my husband suggested I try the cold knob. Sure enough the cold was the hot and the hot was the cold. So I guess C stands for caliente or hot in Spanish. I went out onto the small balcony and sat to enjoy the nice view of the ocean and the boats. Both balcony's on each side of me had very noisy people and I could hear everything they said!!! I went back inside. I really did not enjoy my stay in this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Remote Charmer”
Reviews.Author: Quailrancher
Reviews.Content: First, be aware that Parguera is a long way from the airport in San Juan, which is a good thing depending on what you are looking for. It is barely a town at all, and is a good drive from anything you could call city amenities. It has bars, places to eat and dive shops. That's about it. Villa Parguera has a great view of a bay and is just too cute! But, you can't swim in the Caribbean there and there is no surf. The resort is mainly a refuge for natives, and seems odd to American taste. The setting and natural amenities are what makes the place attractive. The facility itself is OK, but you can't go much further. The semi-isolated location and hotel arrangement make this an excellent place for families with children. The pool is not heated, but has a neat waterfall on one end. The hotel is small, so there is no getting lost there. We were with a group of seniors, and enjoyed the outdoor sitting areas and small dock over the water as places to gather and talk. Night life there is limited to a couple of bars used mainly by locals, which was OK with us, but might disappoint a young crowd. There is a good reason most people rate this parador highly. It is an excellent redoubt for he money.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST part of my week in Puerto Rico!!”
Reviews.Author: Rioguy
Reviews.Content: After three very expensive nights in San Juan and one disgusting nights' stay in Ponce I ended up by accident in La Parguera. Parking within distance of the shoreline the locals said that this motel was the best choice so I went in to check it out. The price was around 70.00 and although the rooms were not fancy, they were very cozy and had everything one can need for a comfortable stay. The air conditioner was new with a remote control and there was a sliding glass door to a balcony on my second floor room. Food in the restaurant smelled delicious but dinners seemed a bit costly so I chose to eat in the plaza with all the tourists and the locals to save some cash. There was delicious food available cheap and the pinchos...shisk ka bobs with chicken, beef, shark, or shrimp in US style barbecue sauce were mouth watering for several dollars each and a meal in themselves. They are even served with a slice of fresh homemade bread! The motel gave me a free ticket to the live show and although geared up for an older crowd there were many younger folks there too and it lasted till after one A.M. IT WAS WONDERFUL!! There is a large, clean pool and a good sized multi-level deck with chaise lounges for sunning. They have a large fenced in parking lot that is guarded day and night and FREE. In the plaza where they sell all the food and mixed drinks they offer trips out into the lagoon to see the phosphorescent glow in the evenings as well as fishing trips. The people of the village were very friendly and even with all the drinking in the cantinas surrounding the main drag I witnessed no drunkenness or trouble. The motel was so enjoyable I stayed three nights. A short drive backtracking in the direction of Ponce is Guanica and the dwarf dry forest and around Guanica and the sea are secluded beaches where one can swim undisturbed. This is really gorgeous country with so many rare animals and exotic native plants as well. Truly a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Seaside Inn”
Reviews.Author: portadelsol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely Parador for three nights, April 18-21. First, the location -- a quaint seaside fisherman village of La Parguera. The town is peaceful during the week and fills up with local folks during the weekends. LaParguera is a great location for scuba diving, snorkeling, boating and kite-surfing to name a few. You can also take a tour of the bio-bay under a moonless night. We took a private tour with Ismael of Aleli Tours. $90 for 4 people. I recommend doing this, vs. taking the big ship tour, since all you can see on the big boat is someone from the crew jumping into the bay. With a small tour, you can get real close to the water and see the bioluminensce. We had an ocean front room. Great air conditioner, excellent balcony with table/chair and a view of the peaceful glass-like waters. TV with cable. The rooms are clean and nice. Nothing too fancy, but not shabby either. Lots of hot water and water pressure. The cleaning staff is a delight. I know that some of the staff have been working at this Parador for years and that is a great plus. The restaurant onsite serves very decent food all day. And great cafe con leche. The pool is very clean and nice, right next to the sea. You can get free wireless access from the lobby of the hotel - just ask the friendly and accomodating front desk. We recommend Johnny's Boats. You can get a great deal, including gas on a pontoon boat. We rented one for 3 hours for about $40, including gas and took it out to the mangroves for some great snorkeling. It's protected and gentle water -- safe for children with their parents. We ate many meals at the local bakery panaderia (it is mentioned positively in many reviews here), LUCERNA. The owner is extremely friendly and accomodating.. The sandwiches and bread are fresh, delicious and cheap!!! And the juices are wonderful. Coffee is excellent too. Please visit this bakery if you visit LaParguerua. The local folks are warm and friendly. We enjoyed many conversations with them in the small plaza nearby and at many of the businesses/ restaurants in town. You can't beat Villa Parguera, if you are looking for a clean, safe and affordable (we paid $99 per night) hotel right on the water!! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a facelift, probably not worth it”
Reviews.Author: niederberger16
Reviews.Content: We made a road trip all the way around the coast of PR, and we felt this part of our trip could have been skipped. Overall, the hotel could really use a facelift. Paint is peeling in many areas, our room had a dank, moldy smell, and the layout of the room was a bit odd. If you are getting a room, I recommend a room that is closer to the pool/reception area because our room overlooked the water but also overlooked a huge, white, tin roof just below us. The pictures may be a bit deceiving...there is a nice pool here because you are not allowed to swim in the ocean water. The view of the water is nice, but it looks more like a lake than the Caribbean sea. The town is a little bit dead. Just a few blocks from the hotel, there are some bars and kiosks, but there were not that many people there (I don't know where the locals go?). This also could be because we came during a mid-week in June (off season). I don't think the hotel is worth the price. If you want to visit beaches or attractions, you need to drive at least 20 min to get somewhere. The receptionists are pleasant, but not overly helpful. Also, be aware that this facility has a function room for weddings/big events. When we were there, a huge crowd of people were there and it was not very conducive to a relaxing experience outside by the pool. The next day, we went out to use the pool in the morning, but a huge group of kids (a field trip) was there and overran us. We did not enjoy our stay as much as we hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Waterside Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lakehouse1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Parador as Paradors go. We had a small room, but it was clean and was a good basic place to stay for the night. The view is beautiful from the courtyard and they have a nice pool for the kids to play in. Only problem is that we had a first floor room and the guests staying on the second floor above us made a huge racket when they got up early in the morning, which always woke us up as well. The ceiling/floor and walls were pretty thin. It is well located for making excursions on the southwest side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: MWG12
Reviews.Content: My children thought we had arrived at an upscale resort when we saw the park-like interior grounds overlooking the water with swaying palm trees and beautiful blue water and mangroves extending out into the distance. In fact, it was not that expensive at all. The rooms were nice, with a small outside sitting area. The pool was very pleasant and the grounds were really really nice. There was a boardwalk extending a short distance out through the mangroves to the water. There was no beach but there is no beach at La Parguera. We chartered a small boat to go snorkling and they picked us up at water's edge by the hotel, which was fun. The restaurant had good food but was a little pricey. I would definitely go back to this Parador.

Reviews.Title: “I like so much I'm Planning my wedding in there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I was Living in the Island I always stayed there at least 3 times a year.. Now everytime I get a chance to visit Puerto Rico YOU BET I stay in the Parador and Next year I will get married in the Parador Villa Parguera!!... Great Service, The BEST FOOD, Nice size ROOMS, really clean and very nice Swimming POOL

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: whereISthebeach?
Reviews.Content: I go to PR every February and stay in San Juan. A few years ago, I wanted to "explore" the island. I found Parador Villa Parguera online, and booked via interent. Well, it was a lucky day for me when I found this lodging. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean, the food is great, and the view is unmatched. I highly recommend the first floor rooms facing the ocean. Sectacular sunsets can be viewed from the dock on the property. All of this in a charming fishing village! This location is very convenient for snorkel trips, boat rides through the mangroves and evening tours of the Phosphorous Bay (best seen without moonlight). We usually take the ride to Gilligan's Island while there. It is walking distance to a convenience store and local seafood restuarants. We have gone back 5 times since our first visit. Our yearly visit to Puerto Rico doesn't seem complete without a visit here.

Reviews.Title: “They don't accept my reservation online!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation by internet and they don't recognize it. It was awful. They said that the website wasn't the true availability. Imagine, I arrived with all my stuff and I had to look for another place in the night!!!! They are people you can't trust

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stop in La Parguera”
Reviews.Author: jrm42000
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on Wednesday, 2/2/05. It's about 175 miles from San Juan. To get there, you can take 52S to 2 to 116 to 304. It's really easy to drive in Puerto Rico. The hotel is right on the water and has a nice patio or balcony for the view. The room was clean, tile floors, no iron. There's a pool. The people weren't as friendly as some of the other places I stayed on my trip. It take you 2 minutes to walk to the plaza where the boats leave for the Phosphorescent Bay. 3 companys each charge $5 for the tour. The town was pretty much dead on Wed night. Most of the places I visited for dinner at 9:45pm were closed. I did go to Dave's which has free internet access and only takes 4 minutes to walk to.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: originally from PR now in Denver, CO
Reviews.Title: “love La Parguera”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have wonderful memories of a beautiful stay at the hotel, in 1993. My husband and I loved our time there together.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxation...”
Reviews.Author: liana013
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Paradores but when you stay at Villa Parguera it's another story!!!!! We stayed at a room with a spectacular view of the ocean, beautiful pool & gardens. The food is excellent, you eat like home. I strongly recommend the show on Saturday night if you know spanish, is hilarious!!! If you are looking for perfect relaxation, and feeling like home this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Villa Parguera, like all paradores we've visited, offers great value! The few extra dollars to secure a waterfront room are well worth it. Although the room was a bit on the small side, the view off the balcony more than made up for it. The restaurant was okay, but not as "native" as we would have liked. Better to take a walk through town (look out for hens leading their chicks down the street) and visit a restaurant or lunch counter frequented by the locals.
